title: Verb patterns with adjectives - 1
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use the B1gerundB2 or the B1to-infinitiveB2.

explain: After a preposition we need to use the gerund.
After 'be able' we need to use the to-infinitive.
After 'give up' we use the gerund.

sentence: Tracy always arrives at work in time. She doesn't want
(work) here?' 'Yes, but I'm a bit bored at
(have) to get up early every day.'
explain: After adjectives we use the to-infinitive.
There's a preposition here (at), so we have to use the gerund.

sentence: This app is not capable of
(select) the users lagging behind with their payments.
explain: There's a preposition here (of), so we need the gerund here.

sentence: (visit) aunt Mavis in Brighton, but my parents have already decided
explain: There's a preposition (on) after keen, so we need the gerund.
